p: HIV testing, diagnosis and linkage to care have been delayed due to suspension or limitation of testing programs during mandatory public quarantine or social distancing measures. Outpatient clinic visits have been shifted to remote encounters when possible, and non‐urgent care has been postponed [ 2, 7]. Individuals that appear to be lost to follow‐up at their usual site of care may be seeking care elsewhere and medical records may not travel with them. Delays in ART initiation and refills have occurred due to loss of insurance, limited pharmacy dispensing capabilities, and/or limited outpatient activities. CD4 and viral load monitoring – central to HIV care – may also be delayed due to less available phlebotomy services or co‐opting of equipment for COVID‐related testing [ 3].
